intro: Alloispermum divaricatum, commonly known as the variable spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal and sandy habitats, often found in the Western and Eastern Cape provinces of South Africa. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the Euphorbiaceae family. Alloispermum divaricatum is adapted to arid conditions and can withstand periods of drought.
